result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Adjourned initial appearance on October 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Makayla Marie Berg
Current: 1200 N Parker Dr, Janesville, WI 53545 United States  (Effective: 10-19-2022)
Prior: 1419 Porter Avenue, Beloit, WI 53511

Activity: Initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:25 PM Defendant Makayla Marie Berg appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kevin M Smith appeared by video for Makayla Marie Berg.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Cash bond set of $7,500.00 with conditions: Not to possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No contact with co-defendant Deonte Flowers.  Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint with GPS monitoring.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 1PM.
